meanings.definition: to make a photographic copy of (a document, book, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She photostatted the important document for her records.
meanings.sent2: The secretary photostatted the report before filing it away.
meanings.sent3: The detective photostatted the clue to keep it safe.
meanings.sent4: His memory photostatted the image of her smile in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The photostatted copy revealed hidden details in the text.

meanings.definition: a photographic copy of a document, book, etc.
meanings.sent1: He kept a photostatted copy of the contract in his drawer.
meanings.sent2: The archive contained many photostatted pages of historical documents.
meanings.sent3: The photostatted book looked like a mirror image of the original.
meanings.sent4: Her mind held a photostatted memory of the old photograph.
meanings.sent5: The photostatted page preserved the text for future reference.
